headline: Honeywell International (NasdaqGS:HON) Appoints Jim Masso to Lead Process Automation Business
summary: Honeywell International (NasdaqGS:HON) recently appointed Jim Masso as President and CEO of its Process Automation unit, a move coinciding with a 31% share price increase over the last quarter, suggesting confidence in its leadership and strategic direction. Recent announcements, including a $2.41 billion acquisition target, new technology alliances, and an AI platform launch, further underscore its commitment to innovation and growth. While the broader market remains relatively stable amid...

headline: Honeywell Is Looking at ‘Strategic Alternatives’ for This Business. The Stock Is Up.
summary: Honeywell  stock rose early Tuesday as the company expanded on its breakup plans, disclosed early in the year.  Management said it would evaluate “strategic alternatives for its Productivity Solutions and Services, PSS, and Warehouse and Workflow Solutions, WWS, businesses, which serve the transportation, warehouse, and logistics markets,” language that means the company is considering selling those operations.  While Honeywell is best known for producing building-automation and aerospace technology, it also designs, manufactures, and integrates complete warehouse-automation solutions.

headline: Honeywell Explores Strategic Alternatives for 2 Units Ahead of Split
summary: Honeywell on Tuesday said it is evaluating "strategic alternatives" for two of its businesses ahead of its plan to split into three public companies by the end of next year.

headline: Honeywell International Aims to Streamline Ahead of Breakup
summary: Honeywell International has started evaluating strategic alternatives for two of its business units, a move the industrial conglomerate said would streamline its business and create value ahead of its split into three companies.

raw.headline: Honeywell International Aims to Streamline Ahead of Breakup

headline: Honeywell to explore options for transportation, logistics businesses
summary: Investing.com -- Honeywell (NASDAQ:HON) said Tuesday it will evaluate strategic alternatives for two of its businesses that serve the transportation and logistics industries as the company prepares for its planned three-way split.

raw.headline: Honeywell to explore options for transportation, logistics businesses
raw.summary: Investing.com -- Honeywell (NASDAQ:HON) said Tuesday it will evaluate strategic alternatives for two of its businesses that serve the transportation and logistics industries as the company prepares for its planned three-way split.

headline: Honeywell to review alternatives for two businesses ahead of 2026 split
summary: Honeywell's review of its 'Productivity Solutions and Services' and 'Warehouse and Workflow Solutions' businesses is aimed at further simplifying its portfolio ahead of the split, the company said.  The two units offer products such as barcode scanners, printing solutions, conveyors and warehouse automation tools among others, and generated more than $1 billion each in revenue in 2024, Honeywell said.

raw.headline: Honeywell to review alternatives for two businesses ahead of 2026 split

headline: HONEYWELL TO EVALUATE STRATEGIC ALTERNATIVES FOR PRODUCTIVITY SOLUTIONS AND SERVICES AND WAREHOUSE AND WORKFLOW SOLUTIONS BUSINESSES
summary: Honeywell (NASDAQ: HON) today announced plans to evaluate strategic alternatives for its Productivity Solutions and Services ("PSS") and Warehouse and Workflow Solutions ("WWS") businesses, which serve the transportation, warehouse and logistics markets. This enables Honeywell to further simplify its portfolio in order to accelerate value creation ahead of its planned separation into three independent, industry-leading companies, which is expected to be complete in the second half of 2026.
